notes: I personally think babies this young should be given time to simply let them follow their own natural sleep rhythms. Although it is said that baby's natural schedule will start to emerge at around 6 weeks, many moms testify that they didn't have a predictable, consistent schedule going until 3 months.

Babies sometimes transition from 3 to 2 naps around 7 to 8 months. When they're just beginning to have 2 naps, it is common for their awake times to go as long as 4 hours, but during this "transition" some parents limit their total wake times to only 9 hours. As the 2 naps become settled, total wake time will start to gradually go back up to 10 hours.
If your baby is taking longer to fall asleep at bedtime, try wiggling your schedule around a little bit:  moving the naptime 15 minutes later, or 15 minutes earlier.
